comments.body: I recommend avoiding rewrapping text unless it's particularly egregious (so e.g. your change above where you're changing a 100+ character line into two lines is fine, but here it doesn't really help anything).

(mostly just because it makes reviewing the patch harder, and in practice we're all likely to have slightly different wrapping algorithms in our IDEs so we're just going to keep going back and forth if we each do this...)

Well, OK, but let's have a conversation sometime about having a style guide that can be applied algorithmically (and so consistently) rather than subjectively. Just like double-spaces before a period bother you, having doc comment lines that go over the line limit bother me... :-)

Oh I'm not saying we shouldn't rewrap the lines, that's fine. I'm just saying we shouldn't rewrap them in otherwise unrelated PRs, because it makes the reviews harder.

If you want to submit a PR that rewraps all the comments appropriately then that would be fine.
(Readability is subjective, though, and the style guide is optimising for readability over all else, so it'll never be truly algorithmic.)

This is great. I think we can make it even better! I think it would be better with two examples, one showing just a simple button with no special colours or styles, and the second showing the version with all the changes you have here.

The reason to have both is that we would want to encourage most people to use the simple version with no styles, and to style their buttons directly from the `Theme` instead.
Sure sir! I'll do the necessary changes to it. :-)
I did the changes sir. Can you please review this?
